name: Antelope
desc: A graceful, fast-moving mammal known for its horns and agility. Antelopes inhabit grasslands and savannas across Africa and Asia.

name: Armadillo
desc: A small mammal with a hard, protective shell. Armadillos are known for their digging ability and live in warm regions.

name: Bear
desc: A large, strong mammal with thick fur. Bears are found in forests, mountains, and arctic regions, known for their strength and adaptability.

name: Bee
desc: A flying insect known for pollinating plants and producing honey. Bees are essential for healthy ecosystems.

name: Box
desc: A simple, isometric box icon. Useful for packaging, storage, or generic container visuals.

name: Badger
desc: A stocky, burrowing mammal with distinctive black and white markings. Badgers are known for their digging prowess and fierce nature.

name: Buffalo
desc: A large, sturdy mammal with horns. Buffaloes live in grasslands and are important for agriculture and wildlife.

name: Cat
desc: A small, carnivorous mammal often kept as a pet. Cats are known for their agility, independence, and playful behavior.

name: Computer
desc: A modern computing device used for work, entertainment, and communication.

name: Phone
desc: A mobile communication device that connects people around the world.

name: Lion
desc: A large, social big cat known as the 'king of the jungle.' Lions live in prides and are found mostly in African savannas.

name: Table
desc: A piece of furniture with a flat top and legs, used for various purposes.

name: Eagle
desc: A powerful bird of prey with keen eyesight. Eagles soar high and hunt small animals.

name: Chair
desc: A seat with a back, designed for one person to sit on.

name: Elephant
desc: The largest land mammal, recognized by its trunk and tusks. Elephants live in herds and are found in Africa and Asia.

name: Lamp
desc: A device that produces light, typically used for illumination in homes and offices.

name: Tiger
desc: A large, striped big cat native to Asia. Tigers are powerful predators and mostly solitary animals found in forests and grasslands.

name: Book
desc: A set of printed or written pages bound together, containing information or stories.

name: Penguin
desc: A flightless bird adapted for swimming. Penguins live in the Southern Hemisphere, mostly in Antarctica.

name: Clock
desc: A device used to measure and display time.

name: Caracal
desc: A wild cat with distinctive black-tipped ears and tufted appearance. Caracals are agile hunters found in Africa and Asia.

name: Caterpillar
desc: The larval stage of butterflies and moths. Caterpillars are known for their segmented bodies and transformation into adults.

name: Chameleon
desc: A colorful lizard famous for changing its skin color. Chameleons live in forests and bushes.

name: Cat
desc: A small, carnivorous mammal often kept as a pet. Cats are known for their agility, independence, and playful behavior.

name: Buffalo
desc: A large, sturdy mammal with horns. Buffaloes live in grasslands and are important for agriculture and wildlife.

name: Cheetah
desc: The fastest land animal, known for its spotted coat and incredible speed. Cheetahs are found in African savannas.

name: Duck
desc: A waterfowl bird with webbed feet and a broad bill. Ducks live near water and are known for their quacking.

name: Eagle
desc: A powerful bird of prey with keen eyesight. Eagles soar high and hunt small animals.

name: Dog
desc: A loyal, social mammal commonly kept as a companion. Dogs are known for their intelligence and trainability.

name: Dolphin
desc: An intelligent aquatic mammal with a sleek body. Dolphins live in oceans and rivers, known for their playful nature and high intelligence.

name: Vulture
desc: A large bird of prey known for scavenging. Vultures help keep ecosystems clean by feeding on dead animals.

name: Tiger
desc: A large, striped big cat native to Asia. Tigers are powerful predators and mostly solitary animals found in forests and grasslands.

name: Urchin
desc: A spiny marine creature with a spherical body. Sea urchins are found on the ocean floor and are important for marine ecosystems.

name: Tortoise
desc: A slow-moving reptile with a protective shell. Tortoises are known for their longevity and can live for over 100 years.

name: Urial
desc: A wild sheep with curved horns, found in Central and South Asia. Urials live in hilly and mountainous regions.

name: Zebu
desc: A type of domestic cattle with a distinctive hump on its shoulders. Zebus are adapted to hot climates and are important for agriculture in many regions.

name: Wolf
desc: A social, intelligent predator living in packs. Wolves are found in forests, tundra, and grasslands across the Northern Hemisphere.

name: Xerus
desc: A ground-dwelling squirrel found in Africa. Xerus live in colonies and are known for their burrowing and social behavior.

name: Wombat
desc: A sturdy, burrowing marsupial native to Australia. Wombats are known for their powerful digging abilities and cube-shaped droppings.

name: Zebra
desc: An African mammal known for its black-and-white striped coat. Zebras live in herds on grasslands and are closely related to horses.
